info.name: Dropbox Team Admin Workflows
info.description:
The powerful, yet simple, Dropbox API allows you to manage and control content and team settings programmatically and extend Dropbox capabilities in new and powerful ways. One of the many areas where the Dropbox API shines is Team Administration. Dropbox Business brings collaboration to professional teams of all sizes, with all the security and control that is required. 

If you are new to Dropbox Business and Team Administration, please have a look at the [Dropobox Admin Guide](https://help.dropbox.com/guide/admin/how-to-get-started#dropbox-admin-guide). 

# Why would you need these workflows?  

Many of the administration tasks can be executed through the web-based Admin Console. However sometimes our Dropbox Business customers need to perform tasks in bulk or automate actions, in a way that is only possible via the API. Furthermore, to accomplish some of these goals it is required to chain a few API calls (the response of a call is the input for the subsequent call), or loop through a list.  

That's why we created the Dropbox Team Admin Workflows Postman Collection. It is aimed at helping Dropbox Administrators on specific tasks, but it can also help developers learn about our APIs. Each folder contains specific workflows that include multiple endpoints that are connected to accomplish specific tasks. 

If you want more information on how to use our API to manage your Dropbox team, please refer to the [Dropbox API Team Administration Guide](https://www.dropbox.com/lp/developers/reference/dbx-team-administration-guide).

# What's in the collection?

These are the workflows contained in this collection:  

**Bulk Provision Users and Add to Groups**  
Create users from a list and add them to appropriate groups  

**Bulk Deprovision Members with Transfer Destination**  
Remove members from a list and transfer their personal data  

**Bulk Deprovision Members without Transfer Destination**  
Remove members from a list and their personal data  

**Bulk Suspend Members**  
Suspend a list of members  

**Bulk Unuspend Members**  
Unsuspend (reactivate) a list of members  

**Bulk Add Users To Groups**  
Add a list of users to appropriate groups  

**Bulk Update Email Addresses**  
Update email addresses for a list of users  

**Bulk Add Groups**  
Create groups from a list  

**Wipe External ID**  
Wipe the External ID field for all users in a team  

**Bulk Update External IDs**
Update specific External IDs using a CSV file

Each workflow has its own folder. Please visit the folder description for instructions on how to execute it. Some workflows require CSV (comma-separated values) files with the input lists. Those formats are in the descriptions, along with links to sample files you can download and use. 

# Authorization

## OAuth 2.0 for API Access
Dropbox uses OAuth 2.0, an open specification, to authorize access to data. To get an OAuth token from Dropbox to enable Postman to access your Dropbox Business team via the API you’ll need to create a new app on the DBX Platform.

## Creating an App on the DBX Platform
Navigate to https://www.dropbox.com/developers/apps and select “Create app” 
1. Choose an API  
2. Choose the type of access you need 
3. Give your app a name  
4. Choose the Dropbox account that will own your app  

For reference, please use the [Dropbox OAuth guide](https://www.dropbox.com/lp/developers/reference/oauth-guide) 

## Generating an Access Token
Once you select “Create app” a page will load that displays information about your newly created app. To generate an access token scroll down to “OAuth 2” and click “Generate” beneath “Generated access token.” The token will display as a long string of characters. Copy this token for use with the Postman Collection.

## Adding an Access Token to the Postman Collection
In the Postman client, click on the three dots to the right of the collection name to "View more actions."

![Screenshot of adding access token](https://www.dropbox.com/s/39kae4jmnjab3dd/Screen%20Shot%202020-07-17%20at%2012.29.33%20AM.png?raw=1)

Then, click "Edit."

![Screenshot of adding access token](https://www.dropbox.com/s/8nprpathnaxag74/Screen%20Shot%202020-07-17%20at%2012.29.57%20AM.png?raw=1)

Click on the "Variables" tab and, in the row for the `access_token` variable, paste your access token in the `CURRENT VALUE` column. The default value is `your-access-token-here`.

![Screenshot of adding access token](https://www.dropbox.com/s/jbd1g3843gviylr/Screen%20Shot%202020-07-17%20at%2012.30.12%20AM.png?raw=1)

For information on sessions and variables in Postman see the blog post at https://blog.postman.com/sessions-faq/.

# Notes
* We use Collection variables for storing values in between requests, as well as input values. Please visit each workflow folder for instructions on how to provide values for these variables.   
* You can find the CSV templates for the workflows [in this folder](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/3thw4wqwn7o07kh/AABug6oNSL7Vxj98fZ6Hnwoka?dl=0).

item.description:
## This workflow will provision one or more users with the details you provide in a CSV file, and then add them to existing groups.

*To run this workflow you will first need to have created a Dropbox App with the appropriate permissions. Once created make sure that you generate an access token and store it in the collection under "access_token".*

## CSV File Setup
To start this workflow you will first need to create a CSV with the relevant data. For each row of the CSV you will need to fill in the following:
1. User's email
2. User's last name
3. User's first name
4. External ID (optional)
   * This is an custom id you can set for an user. Leave blank if you do not want to set.
5. Welcome Email
   * Either enter "true" or "false". This field is case sensitive and it must be all lowercase "true" or "false". This will determine if a user will receive a welcome email or not.
6. Member role
   * The role this member will be assigned with. Options below, must be entered exactly as written.
     * **“team_admin”** - User is an administrator of  the team has all permissions.
     * **“user_management_admin”** - User can do most user provisioning, de-provisioning and management.
     * **“support_admin”** - User can do a limited set of common support tasks for existing users.
     * **“member_only”** - User is not an admin of the team.
7. Group Name
   * The name of the group you will assign users to. This needs to match *exactly* or the user won't be added to the group.

Your CSV file must have the following headers that map to the fields above:

| email | first_name | last_name | external_id | welcome_email | member_role | group_name |
|-------|------------|-----------|-------------|---------------|-------------|------------|

See below for an example table that will provision two members. One will be a team admin, sent a welcome email, and another a normal member without a welcome email.

| email                      | first_name | last_name | external_id | welcome_email | member_role | group_name    |
|----------------------------|------------|-----------|-------------|---------------|-------------|---------------|
| user_admin@dbxexample.com  | John       | Doe       | 1-dbx       | true          | team_admin  | Finance-Admin |
| user_member@dbxexample.com | Jane       | Doe       | 2-dbx       | false         | member_only | Marketing     |

**You can access a template of a csv file [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/xft296emda2zm13/bulk_provision_users.csv?dl=0).**

## Running the Workflow
Once your CSV is setup you're ready to start provisioning users.

1. From Postman click Runner in the left hand corner.
2. In the new Collection Runner window click on "Dropbox API Workflows" then click on "Bulk Provision Users and Add to Groups" folder.
3. Below the collection selector click on "Select File" and pick your CSV file that you've created
4. After the file is uploaded double check your file by hitting the "Preview" and that the number of iterations match the total number of rows you've entered
5. Click "Run Bulk Provision Users and Add to Groups" to kick off the workflow.

item.name: Bulk Deprovision Members with Transfer Destination
item.description:
## This workflow will deprovision one or more users you identify, and indicate a member where all their files will be transferred. You will also designate an admin that will be notified if an error occurs during transfer.

*To run this workflow you will first need to have created a Dropbox App with the appropriate permissions. Once created make sure that you generate an access token and store it in the collection under "access_token".*

## CSV File Setup
To start this workflow you will first need to create a CSV with the relevant data. For each row of the CSV you will need to fill in the following:
1. Team member identifier
   * This is the way you are identifying a team member. Values allowed below:
     * **“email”** - Identify user by email
     * **"external_id"** - Identify user by external id
     * **"team_member_id"** - Identify user by team_member id
2. Team member
   * The team member that you are deprovisioning.
   * Must provide either the user's email, external_id or team_member_id.
3. Destination member identifier
   * Either "email", "external_id", or "team_member_id".
4. Destination member
   * The user that will receive the deprovisioned team member's files.
   * Must provide either the user's email, external_id or team_member_id.
5. Transfer admin identifier
   * Either "email", "external_id", or "team_member_id".
6. Transfer admin
   * An admin user that will receive notifications if an error occurs.
   * Must provide either the user's email, external_id or team_member_id.
7. Wipe Data 
   * Either enter "true" or "false". Controls if the user's data will be deleted on their linked devices.
8. Keep Account
   * Either enter "true" or "false". Downgrades the member to a Basic account. The user will retain the email address associated with their Dropbox account and data in their account that is not restricted to team members. In order to keep the account Wipe Data should be set to "false" and Keep Account set too "true".
9. Retain Team Shares
   * Either enter "true" or "false". Allows removed users to keep access to Dropbox folders (not Dropbox Paper folders) already explicitly shared with them (not via a group) when they are downgraded to a Basic account. Users will not retain access to folders that do not allow external sharing. In order to keep the sharing relationships, Wipe Data should be set to "false" and Keep Account should be set to "true" and Retain Team shares set to "true".

Your CSV file must have the following headers that map to the fields above:

| team_member_identifier | team_member | dest_member_identifier | dest_team_member | transfer_admin_identifier | transfer_admin | wipe_data | keep_account | retain_team_shares |
|------------------------|-------------|------------------------|------------------|---------------------------|----------------|-----------|--------------|--------------------|

See below for an example table that will deprovision two members. One member is referenced with an "external_id", while the other with their email. One member's account is also allowed to keep their account and team shares, while another has their account wiped.

| team_member_identifier | team_member                | dest_member_identifier | dest_team_member             | transfer_admin_identifier | transfer_admin            | wipe_data | keep_account | retain_team_shares |
|------------------------|----------------------------|------------------------|------------------------------|---------------------------|---------------------------|-----------|--------------|--------------------|
| external_id            | 1-dbx                      | email                  | transfer_user@dbxexample.com | email                     | user_admin@dbxexample.com | false     | true         | true               |
| email                  | deprovision@dbxexample.com | external_id            | 2-dbx                        | email                     | user_admin@dbxexample.com | true      | false        | false              |

**You can access a template of the CSV file [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/sqcj0zzmxs6g4nl/bulk_deprovision_users.csv?dl=0).**

## Running the Workflow
Once your CSV is setup you're ready to start provisioning users.

1. From Postman click Runner in the left hand corner.
2. In the new Collection Runner window click on "Dropbox API Workflows" then click on "Bulk Deprovision Members with Transfer Destination" folder.
3. Below the collection selector click on "Select File" and pick your CSV file that you've created
4. After the file is uploaded double check your file by hitting the "Preview" and that the number of iterations match the total number of rows you've entered
5. Click "Run Bulk Deprovision Members with Transfer Destination" to kick off the workflow.

item.name: Bulk Deprovision Members without Transfer Destination
item.description:
## This workflow will deprovision one or more users you identify. You will also designate an admin that will be notified if an error occurs during transfer.

*To run this workflow you will first need to have created a Dropbox App with the appropriate permissions. Once created make sure that you generate an access token and store it in the collection under "access_token".*

## CSV File Setup
To start this workflow you will first need to create a CSV with the relevant data. For each row of the CSV you will need to fill in the following:
1. Team member identifier
   * This is the way you are identifying a team member. Values allowed below:
     * **“email”** - Identify user by email
     * **"external_id"** - Identify user by external id
     * **"team_member_id"** - Identify user by team_member id
2. Team member
   * The team member that you are deprovisioning.
   * Must provide either the user's email, external_id or team_member_id.
3. Transfer admin identifier
   * Either "email", "external_id", or "team_member_id".
4. Transfer admin
   * An admin user that will receive notifications if an error occurs.
   * Must provide either the user's email, external_id or team_member_id.
5. Wipe Data 
   * Either enter "true" or "false". Controls if the user's data will be deleted on their linked devices.
6. Keep Account
   * Either enter "true" or "false". Downgrades the member to a Basic account. The user will retain the email address associated with their Dropbox account and data in their account that is not restricted to team members. In order to keep the account Wipe Data should be set to "false" and Keep Account set too "true".
9. Retain Team Shares
   * Either enter "true" or "false". Allows removed users to keep access to Dropbox folders (not Dropbox Paper folders) already explicitly shared with them (not via a group) when they are downgraded to a Basic account. Users will not retain access to folders that do not allow external sharing. In order to keep the sharing relationships, Wipe Data should be set to "false" and Keep Account should be set to "true" and Retain Team shares set to "true".

Your CSV file must have the following headers that map to the fields above:

| team_member_identifier | team_member                | transfer_admin_identifier | transfer_admin| wipe_data | keep_account | retain_team_shares |
|------------------------|----------------------------|---------------------------|---------------------------|-----------|--------------|--------------------|

See below for an example table that will deprovision two members. One member is referenced with an "external_id", while the other with their email. One member's account is also allowed to keep their account and team shares, while another has their account wiped.

| team_member_identifier | team_member                | transfer_admin_identifier | transfer_admin | wipe_data | keep_account | retain_team_shares |
|------------------------|----------------------------|---------------------------|---------------------------|-----------|--------------|--------------------|
| external_id            | 1-dbx                      | email                     | user_admin@dbxexample.com | false     | true         | true               |
| email                  | deprovision@dbxexample.com | email                     | user_admin@dbxexample.com | true      | false        | false              |

**You can access a template of the CSV file [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/vn6pmmpsroa7phh/bulk_deprovision_users_no_transfer.csv?dl=0).**

## Running the Workflow
Once your CSV is setup you're ready to start provisioning users.

1. From Postman click Runner in the left hand corner.
2. In the new Collection Runner window click on "Dropbox API Workflows" then click on "Bulk Deprovision Members without Transfer Destination" folder.
3. Below the collection selector click on "Select File" and pick your CSV file that you've created
4. After the file is uploaded double check your file by hitting the "Preview" and that the number of iterations match the total number of rows you've entered
5. Click "Run Bulk Deprovision Members without Transfer Destination" to kick off the workflow.

item.description:
## This workflow will suspend one or more users you identify.

*To run this workflow you will first need to have created a Dropbox App with the appropriate permissions. Once created make sure that you generate an access token and store it in the collection under "access_token".*

## CSV File Setup
To start this workflow you will first need to create a CSV with the relevant data. For each row of the CSV you will need to fill in the following:
1. Team member identifier
   * This is the way you are identifying a team member. Values allowed below:
     * **“email”** - Identify user by email
     * **"external_id"** - Identify user by external id
     * **"team_member_id"** - Identify user by team_member id
2. Team member
   * The team member that you are suspending.
   * Must provide either the user's email, external_id or team_member_id.
3. Wipe Data 
   * Either enter "true" or "false". This field is case sensitive and it must be all lowercase "true" or "false". Controls if the user's data will be deleted on their linked devices.

Your CSV file must have the following headers that map to the fields above:

| team_member_identifier | team_member            | wipe_data |
|------------------------|------------------------|-----------|

See below for an example table that will suspend two members. One member is referenced with an "external_id", while the other with their email. One member's account is also allowed to keep their data, while another has their account wiped.

| team_member_identifier | team_member            | wipe_data |
|------------------------|------------------------|-----------|
| external_id            | 1-dbx                  | false     |
| email                  | suspend@dbxexample.com | true      |

**You can access a template of the CSV file [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/brl6sbel84s30tn/bulk_suspend_users.csv?dl=0).**

## Running the Workflow
Once your CSV is setup you're ready to start provisioning users.

1. From Postman click Runner in the left hand corner.
2. In the new Collection Runner window click on "Dropbox API Workflows" then click on "Bulk Suspend Members" folder.
3. Below the collection selector click on "Select File" and pick your CSV file that you've created
4. After the file is uploaded double check your file by hitting the "Preview" and that the number of iterations match the total number of rows you've entered
5. Click "Run Bulk Suspend Members" to kick off the workflow.

item.description:
## This workflow will unsuspend one or more users you identify.

*To run this workflow you will first need to have created a Dropbox App with the appropriate permissions. Once created make sure that you generate an access token and store it in the collection under "access_token".*

## CSV File Setup
To start this workflow you will first need to create a CSV with the relevant data. For each row of the CSV you will need to fill in the following:
1. Team member identifier
   * This is the way you are identifying a team member. Values allowed below:
     * **“email”** - Identify user by email
     * **"external_id"** - Identify user by external id
     * **"team_member_id"** - Identify user by team_member id
2. Team member
   * The team member that you are suspending.
   * Must provide either the user's email, external_id or team_member_id.

Your CSV file must have the following headers that map to the fields above:

| team_member_identifier | team_member            |
|------------------------|------------------------|

See below for an example table that will suspend two members. One member is referenced with an "external_id", while the other with their email. One member's account is also allowed to keep their data, while another has their account wiped.

| team_member_identifier | team_member            |
|------------------------|------------------------|
| external_id            | 1-dbx                  |
| email                  | suspend@dbxexample.com |

**You can access a template of the CSV file [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/3f6jbd5a0fhb5ez/bulk_unsuspend_users.csv?dl=0).**

## Running the Workflow
Once your CSV is setup you're ready to start provisioning users.

1. From Postman click Runner in the left hand corner.
2. In the new Collection Runner window click on "Dropbox API Workflows" then click on "Bulk Suspend Members" folder.
3. Below the collection selector click on "Select File" and pick your CSV file that you've created
4. After the file is uploaded double check your file by hitting the "Preview" and that the number of iterations match the total number of rows you've entered
5. Click "Run Bulk Unsuspend Members" to kick off the workflow.

item.description:
## This workflow will add one or more users to existing groups.

*To run this workflow you will first need to have created a Dropbox App with the appropriate permissions. Once created make sure that you generate an access token and store it in the collection under "access_token".*

## CSV File Setup
To start this workflow you will first need to create a CSV with the relevant data. For each row of the CSV you will need to fill in the following:
1. Group Name
   * The name of the group you will assign users to. This needs to match *exactly* or the user won't be added to the group.
2. Team member identifier
   * This is the way you are identifying a team member. Values allowed below:
     * **“email”** - Identify user by email
     * **"external_id"** - Identify user by external id
     * **"team_member_id"** - Identify user by team_member id
3. Team member
   * The team member that you are adding to a group.
   * Must provide either the user's email, external_id or team_member_id.

Your CSV file must have the following headers that map to the fields above:

| group_name | team_member_identifier | team_member               |
|------------|------------------------|---------------------------|

See below for an example table that will add two members to groups. One will identified via their email, another by their external_id.

| group_name | team_member_identifier | team_member               |
|------------|------------------------|---------------------------|
| Finance    | external_id            | 1-dbx                     |
| Marketing  | email                  | marketing1@dbxexample.com |

**You can access a template of a csv file [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/bp8pd1wozrb0bsb/bulk_add_users_to_groups.csv?dl=0).**

## Running the Workflow
Once your CSV is setup you're ready to start provisioning users.

1. From Postman click Runner in the left hand corner.
2. In the new Collection Runner window click on "Dropbox API Workflows" then click on "Bulk Add Users to Groups" folder.
3. Below the collection selector click on "Select File" and pick your CSV file that you've created
4. After the file is uploaded double check your file by hitting the "Preview" and that the number of iterations match the total number of rows you've entered
5. Click "Bulk Add Users to Groups" to kick off the workflow.

item.description:
## This workflow will update the email addresses of one or more users with the details you provide in a CSV file

*To run this workflow you will first need to have created a Dropbox App with the appropriate permissions. Once created make sure that you generate an access token and store it in the collection under "access_token".*

## CSV File Setup
To start this workflow you will first need to create a CSV with the relevant data. For each row of the CSV you will need to fill in the following:
1. Current email address
2. New email address

Your CSV file must have the following headers that map to the fields above:

current_email | new_email
--------------|----------

See below for an example table that will update 2 users.

current_email | new_email
--------------|----------
bob.smith@example.com   | bob_smith@example.com    
sarah.jones@example.com | sarah.rogers@example.com

**You can access a template of a csv file [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/vrknh7e5sd37vse/bulk_update_emails.csv?dl=0).**

## Running the Workflow
Once your CSV is setup you're ready to start provisioning users.

1. From Postman click Runner in the left hand corner.
2. In the new Collection Runner window click on "Dropbox API Workflows" then click on "Bulk Update Email Addresses" folder.
3. Below the collection selector click on "Select File" and pick your CSV file that you've created
4. After the file is uploaded double check your file by hitting the "Preview" and that the number of iterations match the total number of rows you've entered
5. Click "Run Bulk Update Email Addresses" to kick off the workflow.

item.description:
## This workflow will create one or more groups.

*To run this workflow you will first need to have created a Dropbox App with the appropriate permissions. Once created make sure that you generate an access token and store it in the collection under "access_token".*

## CSV File Setup
To start this workflow you will first need to create a CSV with the relevant data. For each row of the CSV you will need to fill in the following:
1. Group Name
   * The name of the group you will create. This needs to be an **unique** name and cannot match a currently existing group. 
2. Group External ID (optional)
   * This is an custom id you can set for a group. Leave blank if you do not need to set.

Your CSV file must have the following headers that map to the fields above:

| group_name | group_external_id |
|------------|------------------|

See below for an example table that will add two groups. One with an external ID and one without.

| group_name | group_external_id |
|------------|------------------|
| Finance    | group_1_finance  |
| Marketing  |   |

**You can access a template of a csv file [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/wcaof6osdvfzi86/bulk_add_groups.csv?dl=0).**

## Running the Workflow
Once your CSV is setup you're ready to start provisioning users.

1. From Postman click Runner in the left hand corner.
2. In the new Collection Runner window click on "Dropbox API Workflows" then click on "Bulk Add Groups" folder.
3. Below the collection selector click on "Select File" and pick your CSV file that you've created
4. After the file is uploaded double check your file by hitting the "Preview" and that the number of iterations match the total number of rows you've entered
5. Click "Bulk Add Groups" to kick off the workflow.

item.description:
## This workflow will erase all External IDs belonging to all users that have them.

*To run this workflow you will first need to have created a Dropbox App with the appropriate permissions. Once created make sure that you generate an access token and store it in the collection under "access_token".*

## Running the Workflow

1. From Postman click Runner in the left hand corner.
2. In the new Collection Runner window click on "Dropbox API Workflows" then click on "Wipe External ID" folder.
3. Click "Run Wipe External ID" to kick off the workflow.

item.description:
## This workflow will update the External IDs belonging to all users listed in the CSV.

*To run this workflow you will first need to have created a Dropbox App with the appropriate permissions. Once created make sure that you generate an access token and store it in the collection under "access_token".*

## CSV File Setup
To start this workflow you will first need to create a CSV with the relevant data. For each row of the CSV you will need to fill in the following:
1. User's email address
2. New External ID

Your CSV file must have the following headers that map to the fields above:

emailAddress | new_external_id
--------------|----------

**To clear out the external ID completely, leave the second column blank for that user.**

See below for an example table that will update 2 users.

emailAddress | new_external_id
--------------|----------
bob.smith@example.com   | f7139e8f-d4b9-4d0e-952f-89e1598efc76  
sarah.jones@example.com | 

In the example above, the first row is updating the external ID to the value shown but the second row is wiping out the value all together.

**You can access a template of a csv file [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/nr364bzljude39c/bulk_update_external_IDs.csv?dl=0).**

## Running the Workflow
Once your CSV is setup you're ready to updating external IDs.

1. From Postman click Runner in the left hand corner.
2. In the new Collection Runner window click on "Dropbox API Workflows" then click on "Bulk Update External IDs" folder.
3. Below the collection selector click on "Select File" and pick your CSV file that you've created
4. After the file is uploaded double check your file by hitting the "Preview" and that the number of iterations match the total number of rows you've entered
5. Click "Bulk Update External IDs" to kick off the workflow.
